channel.title: AlloyDB for PostgreSQL on MCP Toolbox for Databases
channel.description: Recent content in AlloyDB for PostgreSQL on MCP Toolbox for Databases

item.title: alloydb-pg-create-cluster
item.description:
About

The alloydb-pg-create-cluster tool creates a new AlloyDB for PostgreSQL cluster in a specified project and location. The tool takes the following input parameters: * project : The GCP project ID where the cluster will be created. * clusterId: A unique identifier for the new AlloyDB cluster. * location (optional): The GCP location where the cluster will be created. Default: us-central1. * network (optional): The name of the VPC network to connect the cluster to. Default: default. * user (optional): The name for the initial superuser. Default: postgres. The initial database will always be named ‘postgres’. * password : A secure password for the initial ‘postgres’ user or the custom user provided.
